alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 4:15AM CDT until further notice by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following counties, Cameron, Hidalgo and Willacy. * WHEN...Until 615 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 415 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harlingen, San Benito, Raymondville, La Feria, Los Fresnos, Santa Rosa, South Padre Island, Lyford, Rancho Viejo, Rio Hondo, Palm Valley, Los Indios, Arroyo City, Laureles, Olmito, La Paloma, Rangerville, Cameron Park, Sebastian and Port Of Brownsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
